intro: Llagunoa mandonii, commonly known as the Mandon's lantana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
